name: Grafted Exoskeleton
Grafted Skullcap
text:
At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.
At the beginning of your end step, discard your hand.

editions.flavor: "Every day, I fight for my life and win. Every night, I fight to remember my name and lose."

"Let go your mind. Mine is fitter."
—Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

name: Grafted Wargear
text:
Equipped creature gets +3/+2.
Whenever Grafted Wargear becomes unattached from a permanent, sacrifice that permanent.
Equip {0} ({0}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Grand Abolisher
text: During your turn, your opponents can't cast spells or activate abilities of artifacts, creatures, or enchantments.

editions.flavor: "Your superstitions and mumblings are useless chaff before my righteousness."
"Your superstitions and mumblings are useless chaff before my righteousness."

name: Grand Arbiter Augustin IV
text:
White spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Blue spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Spells your opponents cast cost {1} more to cast.

editions.flavor: The Arbiter is a conduit of justice, a will so disciplined that it dispenses justice without ego or remorse.
The Arbiter is a conduit of justice, a will so disciplined that it dispenses justice without ego or remorse.

name: Grand Architect
text:
Other blue creatures you control get +1/+1.
{U}: Target artifact creature becomes blue until end of turn.
Tap an untapped blue creature you control: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast artifact spells or activate abilities of artifacts.

name: Grand Coliseum
text:
Grand Coliseum enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Grand Coliseum deals 1 damage to you.

name: Grand Melee
text:
All creatures attack each turn if able.
All creatures block each turn if able.

editions.flavor: Hot blood washes away cold reason.

name: Grandmother Sengir
text: {1}{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Rarely have power and madness been so delightfully wed as they have in our dear Grandmother."

text:
Whenever a creature dies, its controller distributes a number of +1/+1 counters equal to its power among any number of target creatures he or she controls.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, each player exiles all creatures he or she controls and creates X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens, where X is the total power of the creatures he or she exiled this way. Then planeswalk.

text:
{R}, {T}: Granger Guildmage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.
{W}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor:

—Granger Guild maxim

name: Granite Grip
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each Mountain you control.

editions.flavor: There's beauty in the desert—but it's best to view it from afar.
"Let me introduce you to Rocky."

name: Granite Shard
text: {3}, {T} or {R}, {T}: Granite Shard deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: It's a piece of a world the goblins have never seen but would dearly like to blow up.

name: Granny's Payback
text: You gain life equal to your age.

editions.flavor: Few remember the exploits of Dakkon's grandmother, Eunice Blackblade.

R&D Comments
BB 10/10: Why does a life-gaining card show an old lady killing people?
MR (10/10/03): We'll fix it in the flavor text.

name: Granulate
text: Destroy each nonland artifact with converted mana cost 4 or less.

editions.flavor: There aren't that many ways to destroy a solid steel weapon, but somehow the goblins keep finding new ones.

name: Grapeshot
text:
Grapeshot deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

editions.flavor: Mages often seek to emulate the powerful relics lost to time and apocalypse.
Mages often seek to emulate the powerful relics lost to time and apocalypse.

name: Grapeshot Catapult
text: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.

editions.flavor: Recent research suggests these creatures were invented by Urza's and Mishra's original master, Tocasia, and that both brothers used them.
For years scholars debated whether these were Urza's or Mishra's creations. Recent research suggests they were invented by the brothers' original master, Tocasia, and that both used these devices.

name: Graphic Violence
text: All creatures by the artist of your choice get +2/+2 and gain trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: WARNING: THE DOMINARIAN SURGEON GENERAL HAS FOUND THAT SAVAGE BEATINGS CAN LEAD TO CHUMP BLOCKS, LIFE REDUCTION, AND EVEN GAME LOSS.

name: Grappler Spider
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor: Creatures of the air wisely avoid the darkest regions of Guul Draz—which is why grappler spiders inhabit the few places touched by the sun's rays.

name: Grapple with the Past
text: Put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard, then you may return a creature or land card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Emrakul does not grant wishes. Desires simply align to her will.

name: Grappling Hook

editions.flavor: Part tool, part weapon, part of the kor.

name: Grasp of Darkness
text: Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: On a world with five suns, night is compelled to become an aggressive force.

"I welcome the use of even the foulest magic if it will rid us of the monstrosities that plague our world."
—Munda, ambush leader

name: Grasp of Fate
text: When Grasp of Fate enters the battlefield, for each opponent, exile up to one target nonland permanent that player controls until Grasp of Fate leaves the battlefield. (Those permanents return under their owners' control.)

text:

editions.flavor: "Everyone deserves a chance to live. My job is to make sure they get it."

text:

text:
Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.

firmly planted.

Reach
{3}{B}: Graverobber Spider gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard. Activate this ability only once each turn.

editions.flavor: The Cabal never expected its creations to create servants of their own.

text:
Trample
Morbid — Gravetiller Wurm enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it if a creature died this turn.

text:

text: Whenever a creature with flying attacks, it loses flying until end of turn.

The great hart stood like a statue, its hide painted gold by the dawn. The Champion laid down her weapons and stepped forward within an arm's length of the beast. The hart, sacred to Heliod and bathed in the god's own light, bowed to the Champion, marking her as the Chosen of the Sun God.
—The Theriad
Perfectly suited for life in the Shifting Wastes, the krushok is well protected by its horn, its hide, and its temper.

An advisor once asked the Western Paladin how much gold would be enough. "I have no need of fools who can imagine ‘enough,'" he told the advisor's corpse.
What is a sliver of one's soul compared to unimaginable wealth?
